Detailed Description

The main class for MIDI handling. See member descriptions for knowing how to use it, or go see the examples supplied with the library.

Definition at line 120 of file MIDI.h.

bool MIDI_Class::read ( const byte  inChannel  ) 

Reading/thru-ing method, the same as read() with a given input channel to read on.

00224          Algorithme:
00225          - Lancer le parseur pour tenter de récupérer un message.

00228          Algo du parseur:
00229          - Récursif (lancé plusieurs fois jusqu'à obtention d'un message ou fin du buffer série)
00230          - Peut utiliser des callbacks (pour la v3.5) quand un message est terminé.
00231          - Compatible avec le running status entrant 
00232          */
00233         
00234         
00235         if (inChannel >= MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF) return false; // MIDI Input disabled.
00236

00242                  - Get the extracted message's channel and compare it to the input channel
00243                  -

00245                 
00246         }
00247

00249 }

bool MIDI_Class::read (  ) 

Read a MIDI message from the serial port using the main input channel (see setInputChannel() for reference).
Returned value: true if any valid message has been stored in the structure, false if not. A valid message is a message that matches the input channel.

If the Thru is enabled and the messages matches the filter, it is sent back on the MIDI output.

Definition at line 216 of file MIDI.cpp.

00216                       {
00217         return read(mInputChannel);
00218 }

void MIDI_Class::sendPitchBend ( double  PitchValue,
byte  Channel 
)

Send a Pitch Bend message using a floating point value.

Parameters:
PitchValue The amount of bend to send (in a floating point format), between -1 (maximum downwards bend) and +1 (max upwards bend), center value is 0.

Definition at line 137 of file MIDI.cpp.

00140         if (pitchval > 16383) pitchval = 16383;         // overflow protection
00141         sendPitchBend(pitchval,Channel);
00142         
00143 }

byte  Channel 
)

Send a Pitch Bend message using an integer value.

Parameters:
PitchValue The amount of bend to send (in an integer format), between 0 (maximum downwards bend) and 16383 (max upwards bend), center value is 8192.

void MIDI_Class::sendRealTime ( kMIDIType  Type  ) 

Send a Real Time (one byte) message.
You can also send Tune Request with this method.

Definition at line 188 of file MIDI.cpp.

00188                                             {
00189         switch (Type) {
00190                 case TuneRequest: // Not really real-time, but one byte anyway.
00191                 case Clock:
00192                 case Start:
00193                 case Stop:      
00194                 case Continue:
00195                 case ActiveSensing:
00196                 case SystemReset:
00197                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write((byte)Type);
00198                         break;
00199                 default:
00200                         // Invalid Real Time marker
00201                         break;
00202         }
00203 }

void MIDI_Class::sendSysEx ( byte  length,
byte *  array,
bool  ArrayContainsBoundaries = false 
)

Generate and send a System Exclusive frame.

Parameters:
length The size of the array to send
array The byte array containing the data to send
Don't put F0 or F7 (start & stop SysEx codes), but put destination device's Manufacturer's ID and/or Device ID in the buffer array.

Definition at line 150 of file MIDI.cpp.

00150                                                                                   {
00151         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF0);
00152         for (byte i=0;i<length;i++) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(array[i]);
00153         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF7);
00154 }

void MIDI_Class::setInputChannel ( const byte  inChannel  ) 

Set the value for the input MIDI channel

Parameters:
channel the channel value. Valid values are 1 to 16, MIDI_CHANNEL_OMNI if you want to listen to all channels, and MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF to disable MIDI input.

Definition at line 529 of file MIDI.cpp.
